definition: related by marriage/to connect by marriage (families, work units)
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet

sentences.english: The ban on intermarriage here is quite specific.
sentences.chinese: 很明確地規定了禁止通婚聯姻。

sentences.english: When plans for that marriage collapsed, he turned to Barclays.
sentences.chinese: 當這個聯姻計劃失敗時，他轉向巴克萊銀行。

sentences.english: and even rich folks marrying each other and doubling up on wealth accumulated at the top.
sentences.chinese: 富人聯姻使財富復加累積到更高。

sentences.english: Copulation could be used for alliance and protection among animals of the same sex.
sentences.chinese: 交配可能被用來在同性當中進行聯姻和保護物種。

sentences.english: So, Tt become possible to marry between Gui opera and tourism.
sentences.chinese: 因此，桂劇與旅遊的聯姻成爲可能。

sentences.english: It's a cents-off coupon married to a Friday-after-Thanksgiving shopping frenzy.
sentences.chinese: 這是象徵性贈券與感恩節週末瘋狂購物的一樁聯姻。

sentences.english: That is, of course, if they ever get to the altar.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這得等到兩大交易所聯姻成功才能蓋棺定論。

sentences.english: But this government was later merged into Chiang Kai-shek's government in Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 但是不久後就與蔣介石的南京政府聯姻合併了。

sentences.english: But can not be said, marketing is the marriage of cars form the main motive.
sentences.chinese: 但是並不能說，營銷就是車表聯姻的主要動機。

sentences.english: The relationship started as a marriage of self-interest.
sentences.chinese: 這場關係剛開始是出於自身利益的聯姻。

sentences.english: But in Los Angeles, the connubial relationship of farm and pharmacy in restaurants is on the march.
sentences.chinese: 但是在洛杉磯，農業和藥學的聯姻關係正在艱難前行。

sentences.english: I don't approve of cousins marrying.
Now a study shows cousins run few risks in mating.
sentences.chinese: 現在一項研究表明近親聯姻並無妨。

sentences.english: The marriage between the two gave them both what they needed.
sentences.chinese: 兩者聯姻讓它們都得到了自己需要的東西。

definition: lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
to pull strings/to manipulate (a puppet)/to control from behind the scene/to mediate
twisted roots and intertwined joints (idiom); complicated and very tricky/knotty and deeply-rooted difficulties
interregional/spanning two or more PRC provinces
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
(fig.) gulf/chasm/wide gap/(originally) the Hong Canal in Henan, which in ancient times formed the border between enemies Chu 楚 and Han 漢|汉
